entries.title: Pitching in 2023 World Baseball Classic moment of growth for Cubs' Javier Assad
entries.summary: <p>MESA, Ariz. — The Cubs already have one player who used the World Baseball Classic to take a leap forward in his development.</p><p>Right-hander <b>Javier Assad</b> was coming off his debut MLB season, with only nine games under his belt, entering the 2023 WBC. He left Cubs camp to pitch for Mexico and proved what a difference-maker he could be in a multi-inning relief role. He allowed only two hits in 5⅔ scoreless innings in the course of the tournament.</p><p>‘‘Big moments against great teams,’’ Mexico manager <b>Benji Gil</b> said of Assad’s outings against the United States in pool play and Puerto Rico in the quarterfinals. ‘‘There’s a handful of guys in the world that have faced the lineups he just faced and dominated.’’</p><p>Much of the talk about the WBC centers on the honor the players feel to represent their countries and on the challenges the schedule presents as teams gear up for the regular season. For many players, however, the big-game atmosphere has its developmental advantages, as well.</p><p>‘‘If you can get to the final rounds, those games are just so much fun that you get to re-create feelings that you have in October games,’’ Cubs manager <b>Craig Counsell</b> said. ‘‘And those are invaluable experiences.’’</p><p>The WBC has more MLB star power this year than ever — quite literally. A record 78 MLB All-Stars, including 36 who got the nod last season, were featured on rosters as of Feb. 5. Thirteen players from the Cubs’ organization are set to participate.</p><p>Assad is one of them, and he’s expected to play an even larger role for Mexico in this tournament.</p><p>‘‘Last time, it was a really great experience, really happy with it,’’ Assad said through an interpreter. ‘‘And I’ll go on to this one looking for new goals in the tournament.’’</p><p>Said Gil: ‘‘I’m just really looking forward to him pitching for us and then afterwards going and establishing himself as one of the better pitchers in the National League.’’</p><h3>Outfield competition</h3><p>The Cubs’ position-player group is largely set, but the competition for bench roles — and particularly a potential spot for a fourth outfielder — will be something to watch.</p><p><b>Matt Shaw</b> has been taking fly balls in the outfield in preparation for a super-utility role and certainly will factor into the equation. Outside of the Cubs’ three regular starters — left fielder <b>Ian Happ</b>, center fielder <b>Pete Crow-Armstrong</b> and right fielder <b>Seiya Suzuki</b> — the Cubs have five other outfielders in camp.</p><p><b>Kevin Alcantara</b> and <b>Justin Dean</b>, whom the Cubs claimed off waivers this offseason, are on the 40-man roster. <b>Brett Bateman</b>, <b>Dylan Carlson</b> and <b>Chas McCormick</b> are non-roster invitees.</p><p><b>Tyler Austin</b> has played outfield in his career and likely will take fly balls as the Cubs make contingency plans, but Counsell said he sees Austin more as a first baseman.</p><h3>Lefty options</h3><p>The Cubs’ bullpen featured three left-handers for stretches of last season, giving Counsell more options against left-handed-heavy lineups. They have five left-handed relievers in camp this year, including returnee <b>Caleb Thielbar</b> and offseason additions <b>Hoby Milner</b> and <b>Ryan Rolison</b>.<br></p>
entries.author: Maddie Lee

entries.title: Shedd Aquarium’s anti-Valentine’s Day event allows cynics, singles to de-stress in nature
entries.summary: <p>There are those who spend Valentine’s Day wining and dining, and then there are those who spend it raging.</p><p>A Shedd Aquarium event at LaGrange Park Woods on Saturday catered to the latter group. About 15 participants burned off steam by snapping, sawing and burning buckthorn, an invasive tree threatening native plants and wildlife in the area.</p><p>Ten-year-old Gideon Majka-Lauterbach grunted as he sliced through thick trunks and hauled large armfuls of the wood to a crackling pyre.</p><p>“To be honest, Valentine's Day is my least favorite holiday,” he said, eliciting a chuckle out of his mother, Meg Lauterbach, 48, of Brookfield.</p><p>“He’s anti-love,” she said.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-6b0000" name="image-6b0000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/f4f20c4/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5934x3330+0+313/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1e%2F38%2F92f1366b4ccf9ddd47b727039e54%2Fvalentinerage-260215-7.jpg width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/67dda56/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5934x3330+0+313/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1e%2F38%2F92f1366b4ccf9ddd47b727039e54%2Fvalentinerage-260215-7.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="Gideon Majka-Lauterbach, 10, drags a tree branch to a fire. "To be honest, Valentine's Day is my least favorite holiday," he says." srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/67dda56/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5934x3330+0+313/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1e%2F38%2F92f1366b4ccf9ddd47b727039e54%2Fvalentinerage-260215-7.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/80a612e/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5934x3330+0+313/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1e%2F38%2F92f1366b4ccf9ddd47b727039e54%2Fvalentinerage-260215-7.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/67dda56/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5934x3330+0+313/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1e%2F38%2F92f1366b4ccf9ddd47b727039e54%2Fvalentinerage-260215-7.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Gideon Majka-Lauterbach, 10, drags a tree branch to a fire. “To be honest, Valentine’s Day is my least favorite holiday,” he says.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Pat Nabong/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>Branded as an “anti-Valentine’s Day” affair in “nature’s rage room,” the event was part of the aquarium’s regular “<a class="Link" href="https://www.sheddaquarium.org/care-and-conservation/take-action-for-animals/shedd-aquarium-action-days" target="_blank" >action days</a>” to restore and safeguard forest preserves and other natural areas. Volunteers included everyone from singles to groups of friends to couples. They worked for a few hours atop an ephemeral pond, which is dry during winter months. And they were rewarded with cookies, a heart-shaped box of chocolates, lollipops and s’mores.</p><p>Though participants admitted to the stress-relief benefits of the activity, no one was especially angry or broken-hearted. They were more interested in the opportunity to spend Valentine’s Day in a unique way and do their part to help the environment.</p><p>“We don't do Valentine's Day, so this is great,” said Kathy Nagy, 62, of the South Loop, who attended with her husband, Michael. “It's a Hallmark holiday. You go out to dinner and get ushered out within 45 minutes because everybody has a waiting list. It's overpriced. This is not how we show love.”</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-660000" name="image-660000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/b7e4758/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5608x3147+0+296/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fce%2F02%2F2ff111a0410daa34ef0343740257%2Fvalentinerage-260215-8.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/7893caa/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5608x3147+0+296/resize/980x550!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fce%2F02%2F2ff111a0410daa34ef0343740257%2Fvalentinerage-260215-8.jpg 2x" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <source width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/ed4a4ef/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5608x3147+0+296/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fce%2F02%2F2ff111a0410daa34ef0343740257%2Fvalentinerage-260215-8.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="Meg Lauterbach, a frequent volunteer, carries European buckthorn. The Shedd volunteers, couples, singles and friend groups, work to restore and safeguard forest preserves and other natural habitats." srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/ed4a4ef/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5608x3147+0+296/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fce%2F02%2F2ff111a0410daa34ef0343740257%2Fvalentinerage-260215-8.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/1f0cd4b/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5608x3147+0+296/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fce%2F02%2F2ff111a0410daa34ef0343740257%2Fvalentinerage-260215-8.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/ed4a4ef/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5608x3147+0+296/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fce%2F02%2F2ff111a0410daa34ef0343740257%2Fvalentinerage-260215-8.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Meg Lauterbach, a frequent volunteer, carries European buckthorn. The Shedd volunteers, couples, singles and friend groups, work to restore and safeguard forest preserves and other natural habitats.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Pat Nabong/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>Buckthorn emits a toxic chemical called emodin. Clearing the invasive tree allows bottlebrush, wood reed grass and Joy Pyre weed to flourish in the soil and toads, frogs and salamanders to thrive in the pond. The volunteers made an impressive amount of headway toward this effort at Saturday’s event, which was marketed in a playful way to entice people to experience the natural areas in their communities, said Evelyn Alvarez, the coordinator of conservation action at Shedd Aquarium.</p><p>“It's a really fun and engaging way to get people to learn about the harmful things in our environment, what they can do to make an impact for their local spaces, and also a really great way to connect with other people with similar interests,” she said.</p><p>Antonio Marquez and Kayla Reum said throwing the trees on the fire was the best part of the day. The two teenagers attended with a group of friends. Reum dyed her hair pink for the occasion, and Marquez’s jeans with flaming pink hearts were chosen unintentionally.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-5c0000" name="image-5c0000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/3a0bef5/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4675x2624+0+247/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd5%2F7f%2F391fa1a74632863c65523c5492e2%2Fvalentinerage-260215-20.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/94c9c38/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4675x2624+0+247/resize/980x550!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd5%2F7f%2F391fa1a74632863c65523c5492e2%2Fvalentinerage-260215-20.jpg 2x" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <source width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/1c43153/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4675x2624+0+247/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd5%2F7f%2F391fa1a74632863c65523c5492e2%2Fvalentinerage-260215-20.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="Antonio Marquez (right) throws a piece of European buckthorn into a pile after cutting it on Valentine’s Day during Shedd Aquarium’s volunteer action days at LaGrange Park Woods in La Grange, Ill., Saturday, Feb. 14, 2026." srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/1c43153/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4675x2624+0+247/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd5%2F7f%2F391fa1a74632863c65523c5492e2%2Fvalentinerage-260215-20.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/18152b1/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4675x2624+0+247/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd5%2F7f%2F391fa1a74632863c65523c5492e2%2Fvalentinerage-260215-20.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/1c43153/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4675x2624+0+247/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd5%2F7f%2F391fa1a74632863c65523c5492e2%2Fvalentinerage-260215-20.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Antonio Marquez (right) throws a piece of European buckthorn into a pile after cutting it on Valentine’s Day. “I’m just trying to do my part for the community,” he said.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Pat Nabong/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>“I’m just trying to do my part for the community,” said Marquez, 19, of La Grange Park. “It’s nice to come out here and make a difference. And it's Valentine's Day. I didn't have anything planned, so I might as well hang out with all the homies.”</p><p>Marquez also praised the instant gratification of eradicating the buckthorn.</p><p>“I'm seeing all these mushrooms,” he said. “It’s like you're making a way for more nature, and it's beautiful.”</p><p>Abbey Hays said the activity did allow her to work through some emotions, though they weren’t tied to romance.</p><p>“It’s just the aggression of not really knowing how to exist in this world as a young woman, and the standards changing so fast,” said Hays, 28, of Pilsen, who has participated in similar conservation efforts. “I love to be outdoors. I usually lead crews. And not everybody likes that in a woman. Not everybody expects that in a woman.”</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-be0000" name="image-be0000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/5c464ba/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6724x3774+0+355/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fc8%2Fc4%2Fce694f074eef8fc943a219055b2c%2Fvalentinerage-260215.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/1d163a2/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6724x3774+0+355/resize/980x550!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fc8%2Fc4%2Fce694f074eef8fc943a219055b2c%2Fvalentinerage-260215.jpg 2x" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <source width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/e769c8e/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6724x3774+0+355/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fc8%2Fc4%2Fce694f074eef8fc943a219055b2c%2Fvalentinerage-260215.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="Abbey Hays says participating in Shedd's volunteer action days on Valentine's Day is her "love letter" to nature. " srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/e769c8e/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6724x3774+0+355/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fc8%2Fc4%2Fce694f074eef8fc943a219055b2c%2Fvalentinerage-260215.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/22f4868/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6724x3774+0+355/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fc8%2Fc4%2Fce694f074eef8fc943a219055b2c%2Fvalentinerage-260215.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/e769c8e/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6724x3774+0+355/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fc8%2Fc4%2Fce694f074eef8fc943a219055b2c%2Fvalentinerage-260215.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Abbey Hays says participating in Shedd’s volunteer action days on Valentine’s Day is her “love letter” to nature. </p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Pat Nabong/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>As for Valentine’s Day, she said she had “mixed feelings.”</p><p>“I'm happy for everybody who gets to celebrate with the people they love,” she said. “But for some people, it's just a day, and you get to do whatever you want with that day.”<br></p>
entries.author: Erica Thompson
